channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Southwest is the latest big firm to choose a CFO search over succession planning
item.description: Tammy Romo, EVP and CFO at Southwest Airlines, will retire on April 1.

item.title: Map: 6.8-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Japan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Battle Inside Kursk, With Waves of Tanks, Drones and North Koreans
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers are describing fierce clashes as Russian forces try to retake territory in the Kursk region that could be key in eventual cease-fir...

item.title: Talks on Gaza Cease-Fire and Hostage Releases: What to Know
item.description: The negotiations appeared to be gaining momentum on Monday as Arab and American mediators pushed for an agreement before President-elect Donald J. Tru...

item.title: Melania Trump Says She Plans to Be at White House Full Time
item.description: Mrs. Trump did not immediately move in to the White House when her husband was inaugurated in 2017, but she said the second stay was going to be more ...

item.title: ‘Will Pay Any Amount’: Private Firefighters Are in Demand in L.A.
item.description: Hiring a private fire crew costs thousands of dollars a day, and most work through government contracts or with insurance companies. Some wealthy prop...

item.title: Meta’s oversight board blindsided by Mark Zuckerberg’s decision to relax hate speech restrictions
item.description: Michael McConnell fears the decision by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to eliminate fact checking will not work.

item.title: A New Age of American Interference in Europe
item.description: Elon Musk and MAGA are already disrupting the status quo, and Europe seems ill-prepared.

item.title: Honeywell CEO: AI will transform industry at scale beginning in 2025
item.description: Think autonomous, not automated, operations as the industrial sector embraces the trifecta of AI, 5G, and the cloud.

item.title: No One Should Be Scoring Political Points Over a Fire
item.description: It’s way too soon for ideological score-settling.

item.title: Planters will pay you $45,000 a year—plus health benefits, travel expenses and a 401(k)—to drive the NUTmobile around the country
item.description: Job start date is in June.

item.title: A Stargazers’ Guide to Watching the Full Moon Pass Mars and the a New Come
item.description: On Monday night you may have a chance to witness the moon obscuring the Red Planet at its brightest, as well as a comet’s closest approach to the sun.

item.title: The Pitched Battles for Partisan Control in State Legislatures
item.description: As state legislatures convene, they face the same political polarization seen in Congress. Some are in near-deadlock.

item.title: How Lagging Vaccination Could Lead to a Polio Resurgence

item.title: Walmart is getting its first logo ‘refresh’ in 17 years—and its marketing chief explains why
item.description: The company hopes to make the Walmart spark as recognizable as Apple's logo and Starbucks' mermaid.
